result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew B. Cagle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

Counseling as recommended.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

records.addlTxt:
Case called:  9:04 am
Includes 13CF891 and 14CF118.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence for ADA Kyle Mayo:
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Julie Sawyer;
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
13CF891:
Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Covert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine-Second and Subsequent Offense)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>DRI.
Ct. 5 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>DRI.
Ct. 6 (Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)>>DRI.

14CF118:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (Theft-Movable Property-PTAC)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
13CF891:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine-Second and Subsequent Offense)>> GUILTY.

14CF118:
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony)>> GUILTY.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
13CF891:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine-Second and Subsequent Offense)>> Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation, concurrent. CONDITIONS: 1 Year MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination, No objection to EMP, Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, AODA and follow up, counseling as recommended, Good faith effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. COURT finds 20 days credit.

14CF118:
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony)>> Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation, concurrent. CONDITIONS: Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, AODA and follow up, counseling as recommended, Good faith effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. 

Atty Sawyer makes argument to the bonds that were forfeited and furlough.
COURT ORDERS: forfeits $1,000 instead of $10,000.
COURT does not grant furlough.

Adjourned: 9:20 am
Pre-trial conference at 12-10-2015 09:15 am
